title: Nuno Espirito Santo still an advocate of VAR despite technology ruling out two Wolves goals
text:
Wolves manager Nuno Espirito Santo remains a supporter of the VAR system despite having two goals ruled out during the 1-1 draw with Southampton at Molinuex.

Raul Jimenez twice had the ball in the net in the first half but both were disallowed - one for handball by the Mexican, the other because a teammate was fractionally offside.

But Espirito Santo said: " It makes the game more fair.

Nuno Espirito Santo insists he remains a fan of VAR after Wolves' draw with Southampton

" We have to get used to it. Sometimes it is tough. It changes the mood when you celebrate what turns out to be a non-goal.

"It changes the mood in the stadium as well when you think you have a goal and then it is not a goal.

"But VAR is there to judge. We have to accept it."
description: Wolves manager Nuno Espirito Santo insists he is still a supporter of technology despite it ruling out two strikes from Raul Jimenez in their 1-1 draw with Southampton.
